# mythicbeasts_vps_hosts (Data Source)

Returns private cloud host capacity and availability information. Use this data source to choose `host_server` for [`mythicbeasts_vps` resource](../resources/vps) deployments.

## Example Usage

```terraform
terraform {
  required_version = ">= 1.11.0"

  required_providers {
    mythicbeasts = {
      source = "paultibbetts/mythicbeasts"
    }
  }
}

data "mythicbeasts_vps_hosts" "all" {}

output "hosts" {
  value = data.mythicbeasts_vps_hosts.all
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Read-Only

- `hosts` (Attributes Set) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--hosts))

<a id="nestedatt--hosts"></a>
### Nested Schema for `hosts`

Read-Only:

- `cores` (Number)
- `disk` (Attributes) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--hosts--disk))
- `free_disk` (Attributes) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--hosts--free_disk))
- `free_ram` (Number)
- `name` (String)
- `ram` (Number)

<a id="nestedatt--hosts--disk"></a>
### Nested Schema for `hosts.disk`

Read-Only:

- `hdd` (Number)
- `ssd` (Number)


<a id="nestedatt--hosts--free_disk"></a>
### Nested Schema for `hosts.free_disk`

Read-Only:

- `hdd` (Number)
- `ssd` (Number)
